channel.title: Duel arena help and new player spawn help!
channel.description:
Okay so I have two problems, one is that in a duel arena stake the winner stays in the arena and the loser gets teleported out. and the winner doesn't get the stake winnings.
The second problem is that under
public void addStarter() {
I have c.getPA().startTeleport(2443, 4956, 0, "modern"); Because I want a new player to have a different starting location. but when I use that teleport code it freezes the game client. only for a new player not a already registered player.

item.title: Duel arena help and new player spawn help!
item.dc:creator: @seankroes seankroes
item.description:
@seankroes wrote:

The problem with the duel arena is that after a player wins a stake the player who wins gets teleported out first. then after the other player dies you get teleported to another spot in the duel arena and win… Also I want to add a second screen to the duel arena stake screen and it doesnt show if the other player has accepted or not.

Read full topic
item.source: Duel arena help and new player spawn help!

item.title: Duel arena help and new player spawn help!
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

seankroes:

Not the commands also a couple bugs with the duel arena.

The commands should be consider unrelated since you have another topic about them.

What are your problems with duel arena?

Also remember this is a help section. Not a “step by step guide on how to make your server perfect” section. You need to take some initiative and find tutorials, guides, etc and read them. Java docs and tutorials are helpful to learn the actual code, RSPS tutorials are only helpful to learn the structure of the RSP, and how some shit is named.

Read full topic

item.title: Duel arena help and new player spawn help!
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

For the new player position:

in your player class, you should have a constructor nearly identical to:

Within that constructor, you’ll have code that looks like (or is close to):

[code=java]

	playerEquipment[playerHat] = -1;
	playerEquipment[playerCape] = -1;
	playerEquipment[playerAmulet] = -1;
	playerEquipment[playerChest] = -1;
	playerEquipment[playerShield] = -1;
	playerEquipment[playerLegs] = -1;
	playerEquipment[playerHands] = -1;
	playerEquipment[playerFeet] = -1;
	playerEquipment[playerRing] = -1;
	playerEquipment[playerArrows] = -1;
	playerEquipment[playerWeapon] = -1;

	teleportToX = Config.START.getX();
	teleportToY = Config.START.getY();
	heightLevel = Config.START.getZ();[/code]

On my server, the START variable is a Position object, which contains the X, Y, Z of any given point…
But that’s unrelated.
Change the Config.START.getX();, Config.START.getY();, Config.START.getZ(); to the coords you want.
(Again, your server probably has a different variable here).

As for the duel victory/loss thing:

In the code that awards your winner, make it send the loser back to the exit.
The code should be in DuelAndTrade.java. I can’t help much more as I’ve removed that class (As trading/Dueling don’t need to be handled in the same class…) and rewrote most of the core of dueling.

Read full topic
